summary: This bill, the "Making It Likely for Families of the Military to Live with Leave Access Act" (MIL FMLA Act), amends the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 and related provisions in U.S. Code Title 5 to expand family and medical leave for military families and veterans. It extends leave eligibility to include domestic partners, expands the definition of “son or daughter” for leave purposes, and clarifies leave provisions for serious injuries or illnesses incurred in line of duty. It also defines various family relationships (e.g., in-law, sibling) for eligibility.  The bill also impacts Federal Civilian employees.
